title: Virtual World-Based Advanced Mathematics Inquiry for [K-12]: Utilizing Multi-User Environments

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics (calculus, linear algebra) and programming basics
context.additional_context: Learners collaborate in virtual environments to solve complex mathematical problems, structured with two weekly face-to-face classes and three virtual sessions

learning_goals: Learners can generate 3D geometric models in a virtual world environment to visually interpret nonlinear equations.

Over 2–4 weeks, learners can collaborate with peers in a multi-user virtual environment (e.g., Minecraft Education Edition) to analyze three optimization problems (e.g., resource allocation, path optimization), propose solutions applying a 5-step strategy design process (problem definition → data collection → modeling → simulation → evaluation), and write a collaborative report meeting four or more of the five peer evaluation rubric items.
Learners create reports applying mathematical reasoning based on data collected through virtual world activities
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
